result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell A Kraus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: *Restitution to be paid for Victim A from case 20CM2043. Cash bail previously posted in 20CM2043, 20CT1051 and 21CM873 applied, balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

*Costs to be paid as a condition of probation
*If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment. 
*Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
*Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent
*No contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint in case 20CM2043
*No operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license
*Defendant is not to possess any firearms

timeConds.notes: *Perform 25 hours of community service at Agent's direction.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mitchell A Kraus

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Herbers advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

Returned Electronic Notice for Mitchell A Kraus - Judgment Conviction
Return to Sender. No Mail Receptacle - Unable to Forward
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Filed by Atty. Herbers requesting to have the 9/15/2022 hearing converted to plea and sentencing if possible.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Filed by Atty. Herbers.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty. Herbers as counsel of record for the defendant.
Hearing on September 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:31 PM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Zachary A Wittchow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mitchell A Kraus in court. Court notes the matter is before the Court with respect to status.  Atty. Wittchow notes based on some discussions off the record the defendant was not able to retain private counsel and is working to try to contact the PD's office to see if he qualifies for representation.  Defendant confirms that information, he adds he attempted to call the Public Defender's office but was not able to talk to someone this afternoon to see if he qualifies.  Court will adjourn for status of counsel in about 30 days.
Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Letter filed by the defendant requesting an adjournment of the the next hearing.  ** Reviewed by Judge Lau on 7/19/22 - Hearing has to be rescheduled due to a trial.** Request granted.
Hearing on July 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:50 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Mitchell A Kraus in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Nikole Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews the case and notes that the petition for court appointed attorney was denied by the Court and inquires how the matter will be proceeding.  Defendant presents statements, he would like to get these matters resolved but is also still working on obtaining private counsel.  Court will adjourn for status of counsel and further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Order Appointing Counsel Denied

** Reviewed by Judge Lau on 04-13-22.** Petition denied. The defendant is not indigent.
**Clerk to prepare order- MAM**
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Hearing on June 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:50 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Mitchell A Kraus in court.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquires if the defendant plans to proceed without counsel.  Defendant presents statements.  Court reviews the case and notes at the last appearance before the Commissioner it was noted that the defendant did not qualify for a public defender.  Court notes the defendant should have been advised that he could have an attorney appointed by the Court and should have been provided with paperwork to petition for an attorney.  Defendant advises he would like to have an attorney appointed.  Court advises the defendant he would need to complete the appropriate paperwork for a court appointed attorney.  Defendant presents additional statements.  Atty. Sitzberger outlines what the initial offer was with regards to the older matter, but due to the matter pending for so long that offer is no longer available.  Atty. Sitzberger also notes there is not currently a global offer in the file and recommends the defenant contact the DA's office to inquire as to the current offer as to all of the matters.  Defendant just wants to resolve the matters.  Court provides the defendant with the petition for court appointed attorney in court.  Court will also provide the defendant with the ADA assigned to the case and his contact phone number.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on April 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant is not to use/possess any firearms unless properly licensed.

10:36 AM Defendant Mitchell A Kraus in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant will proceed without counsel.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.
